data.title: A Unique Restaurant And A Welcome Addition To High Point
data.text: A wonderful crepe restaurant.  The crepes are large and you should plan on sharing as one person could not do them justice.  Very good value for the money and inexpensive.  There are only a few tables so plan accordingly.  Downtown High Point is fairly empty at night so that is a good time to go.  I had the veggie crepe and shared a dessert crepe with my friend.  This unique restaurant is a great addition to High Point!

data.title: Get the Kitchen Sink
data.text: Amazing crepes with every kind of non-meat you could imagine available as a filling. Meat would be great to mix into these, but due to some technicalities with some food prep laws, it's infeasible for them to add, sadly. But trust me, you won't miss it. The worst part was deciding what to get, because so many of their combinations sounded amazing. I ended up getting The Kitchen Sink, which contains virtually every filling they offer. It was amazing. Get it.

data.title: Bright spot in High Point
data.text: This hidden gem is a crepe shop.  Get the "scrape the floor" crepe, it's my favorite. A family run business that offers fresh crepe's and lively conversation.  Not much room to sit down, but great fun.

data.title: Don't miss out
data.text: I took my wife and daughter to Penny Path as a surprise trip because it was something novel and promising to be delicious. We were not let down. The little shop was clean and succinct. Walking into the shop it felt comfortable and like a place we could spend some time. The service was excellent and friendly. There were no glares when our two year old decided to get a little loud. Instead, one of the employees came over and chatted with our daughter. Awesomeness. We didn't take advantage of the bat seating to watch out crepes made, but there's always next time. The food arrived and smelled awesome. The offerings were filling and full of fresh flavor. I wish there was more meat options on the menu, but that might just be me. We shared two crepes and felt satisfying full. Then, decided we had to get a dessert crepe or two as well. Good choice. Again, light enough to eat all of it but hearty enough to feel filling. Going back again will be an easy choice.

data.title: Surprisingly Good Food!
data.text: Very unique setting, very unique menu. No meat in the place--perfect place for dessert or a snack. The crepes we had were both sweet and were a perfect treat, but definitely not a meal.

data.title: Eclectic & Memorable!
data.text: Following a recommendation, we visited Penny Path for coffee.  It was great & we were intrigued by the crepes.  Left w coffee but 2 hours later came back for lunch.  Wonderful!!  Never had a crepe like the special & we truly enjoyed the food & the experience.  Milos, thank you.  Come back to Greenville.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Delicious food. Friendly service. May need to park near the train station. Worth the drive to high point if not local.

data.title: Odd but Good
data.text:
We went there to have an early lunch and do a little business.  It's small but seemed charming. I did have to move a floor mat out of my booth seat and the table wasn't totally wiped but ...oh well. 

The crepes were excellent!  I think a little pricey but very good.  We also split a sweet crepe and it was fantastic! 

I recommend but don't expect too much other than a wonderful crepe.

data.title: Great little cafe
data.text: We stopped and had 3 different crepes. All were excellent. The kitchen sink is very filling. I had a spiced chai latte as well which was great. Owners very friendly. I'll be back.

data.title: Amazing service
data.text: This quiet cafe has delicious crepes! Great friendly service!! Sometimes they let you make your own!!!

data.title: Heaven in a Crepe.
data.text: I was visiting family and was so happy to be able to stop and eat at Penny Path Cafe. It's a small place so we sat at the counter and watched our food being prepared. I shared the kitchen sink crepe with my daughter, the grandchild enjoyed the  cheese crepe. Both were wonderful. We also shared two sweet crepes. Loved the people working there, the cappuccino, service, five stars. So good that I will go again tomorrow before I return home.

data.title: Awesome crepes; slow service
data.text: The menu is limited, but the crepes are fabulous!  Drink selections are slim to none - water is served in paper cups. If you are in a hurry, you should find somewhere else. But, if you have the time, the crepes are very much worth it!

data.title: Recommended by friend.
data.text: Was glad a friend recommended this crepe restaurant. Walking distance to the Radisson, great food, very accommodating of special orders. (Gluten free). Large portions.

data.title: Hidden treasure
data.text: The only true crepe restaurant in High Point, NC.  Very small, quaint restaurant. Up close and personal with the crepe makers.  Not for meat and potato guys, but fun to watch crepes being made.  Parking on the street can be challenging.

data.title: Crepes are quite good but....
data.text:
Cleanliness of the place is moderate.  Not bad but not really very good.  If you are sensitive to that then this might not be for you.
 The very small dining room was filled with smoke from cooking the entire visit.  Smelled good but got irritating after a little while.
Food was good but one of the two women working that day was really a bit of a grouch.  We were definitely an inconvenience to her.  The other server was pleasant.
I will be back as a quick, good lunch spot but will probably get it to go.

data.title: Good crepes
data.text: Being French, I have my own standards of a good crepe and I have to say, penny path is pretty good, the value for the size of the crepe you get is also really good. the staff was amazingly nice and helpful. my only downside was we saw online it had outside sitting , since we had our dog with us, we went there and expected a patio, it is in fact , just a few tables on the side of the street looking at another building and parking area; not so much of a big deal, we should have researched more and would have seen it was in the downtown area and most likely would be in a tight spot. We still really enjoyed the crepes, and the nice lattes for a quick breakfast and went on with our day.

data.title: Worth the drive
data.text: Fabulous. Funky little place. Eclectic and welcoming I was traveling solo and was welcomed in and the way we all (customers and staff alike) talked together it was like a day out with your best friends. The crepes are amazing and made right in front of you and you are welcomed to customize the filling any way you like. A little pricey if your on a budget but we'll worth it being made to order your way right in front of you. Delicious just like mom used to make.

data.title: Delicious and fun!
data.text:
In town to bring my son home from school...he took us here because he's enjoyed it this year. 
Wow!  Very tasty!
The "Kitchen sink" crepe was fabulous! The desert crepes also well made!

The owner is very community conscious. He seems to be making a difference in the area!  Way to go!

Stop bye for a meal or treat!!!

data.title: What a Great Find in a small town
data.text:
This little hole in the wall was perfect for us. The food was fresh, the place was very small, and you get to know everyone in the room.

We had the Kitchen Sink for dinner, which was filled with lots of fresh vegetables and other goodies, and was perfect for sharing for two people. For dessert we had an apple crepe, which was also fresh, and home made whipped cream. Tasty!

We got out for dinner for under $25 for two people (they do not serve alcohol)

data.title: DELICIOUS!
data.text:
Okay, so: we were in town from Friday night to Sunday morning for a wedding and we managed to eat here TWICE, it was so good. The Kitchen Sink crepe is delicious (and HUGE, SO FILLING) and every single thing my group ordered was delicious. We took a suzette to go. We returned Sunday morning for a quick brunch before hitting the road- cinnamon apples and candied walnuts.

Service is great, owner is too kind. The Penny Path is also more than happy to make substitutions/additions to their listed crepes and were extremely accommodating for our friend with food sensitivities.
